com.compunet.stuforia.JustifiedTextView.noghteh:text: Power of attorney is granted to an "attorney-in-fact" or "agent" to give that individual in legal authority to make decision for an incapacitated "principal". The lows for creating a power of attorney vary from state to state, but there are certain general guidelines to follow. Before you or a loved one signs any document, however, be sure to consult with an attorney concerning all applicable laws and regulation.
